title: Islam and Contemporary Malay Society
description:
This module examines competing religious orientations that had evolved among the Malays of Singapore and socio-historical factors that had shaped such orientations. The ways in which these orientations condition their responses to the modern world are then discussed. The module analyses the contributions of Muslim religious thinkers to socio-economic reform of the community. A critical 
analysis of the phenomenon of Islamic resurgence and its impact on the community’s progress will also be examined. A theme underlying the module is the relevance of Islamic values in facilitating Malays adaptation to the demands of social change and pluralistic society.
